skill.name: azure-compliance
skill.description: Comprehensive Azure compliance and security auditing capabilities including best practices assessment, Key Vault expiration monitoring, and resource configuration validation. USE FOR: compliance scan, security audit, azqr, Azure best practices, Key Vault expiration check, compliance assessment, resource review, configuration validation, expired certificates, expiring secrets, orphaned resources, policy compliance, security posture evaluation. DO NOT USE FOR: deploying resources (use azure-deploy), cost analysis alone (use azure-cost-optimization), active security hardening (use azure-security-hardening), general Azure Advisor queries (use azure-observability).
skill.summary: Official Microsoft skill for Azure compliance scanning, Key Vault expiration monitoring, and security best practices assessment
skill.author: microsoft

security_audit.summary: This is an official Microsoft Azure compliance documentation skill. Static findings flagged Azure CLI commands in markdown documentation, reference URLs to Azure documentation, and mentions of deprecated protocols - all are legitimate compliance content. The skill provides remediation patterns, SDK references, and best practices for Azure compliance. No malicious intent detected.

content.value_statement: This skill helps security teams audit Azure resources for compliance violations, monitor Key Vault expiration dates, and implement remediation best practices using official Microsoft tooling.
actual_capabilities: Run Azure Quick Review (azqr) compliance scans across subscriptions
Monitor Key Vault keys, secrets, and certificates for expiration
Query Azure Resource Graph for compliance findings
Provide remediation patterns for common compliance issues
Generate compliance reports with priority classifications
Access SDK references for programmatic Key Vault access
limitations: Does not deploy or modify Azure resources
Does not perform active security hardening
Does not analyze costs or provide cost optimization advice
Requires Azure authentication via az login

use_cases.title: Security Teams Running Periodic Audits
use_cases.description: Security teams use this skill to perform scheduled compliance audits across Azure subscriptions, identifying misconfigurations and expired certificates.

use_cases.title: DevOps Validating Resource Configurations
use_cases.description: DevOps engineers validate that newly deployed resources meet organizational compliance policies before production deployment.

use_cases.title: Cloud Administrators Monitoring Key Vault
use_cases.description: Cloud administrators monitor Key Vault to prevent service disruptions from expired certificates, secrets, and keys.

prompt_templates.title: Run Full Compliance Scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Run azqr compliance scan on my Azure subscription and summarize the findings by severity

prompt_templates.title: Check Key Vault Expirations
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me all expired and expiring (within 30 days) keys, secrets, and certificates in my Key Vault

prompt_templates.title: Find Specific Compliance Issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all storage accounts without private endpoints and show me the remediation steps

prompt_templates.title: Generate Compliance Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a comprehensive compliance report for my subscription including all critical and high findings with remediation recommendations

best_practices: Run compliance scans on a regular schedule (weekly or monthly) to track trends over time
Separate compliance reporting from remediation execution to maintain audit trails
Use priority classifications to focus remediation efforts on critical and high findings first
anti_patterns: Do not use this skill for deploying resources - it is read-only compliance assessment
Avoid running scans on production subscriptions during business hours without scheduling
Do not ignore medium and low findings - they often become critical over time

faq.question: What is azqr?
faq.answer: azqr (Azure Quick Review) is a Microsoft tool that scans Azure resources for compliance against best practices. It identifies configuration issues and provides remediation recommendations.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my Azure resources?
faq.answer: No, this skill only reads and analyzes your Azure resources. It does not modify, deploy, or delete any resources. Remediation commands are provided as documentation for you to execute separately.

faq.question: What permissions do I need to run scans?
faq.answer: You need Azure Reader role or equivalent permissions to run compliance scans. For Key Vault expiration monitoring, you need Key Vault Reader permissions.

faq.question: How often should I run compliance scans?
faq.answer: Microsoft recommends running compliance scans weekly for active environments and at least monthly for stable environments. Run additional scans after major deployments.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, you can integrate azqr scans into CI/CD pipelines. The skill provides the commands and documentation for automated compliance checking in deployment workflows.

faq.question: What is the difference between this and Azure Advisor?
faq.answer: Azure Advisor provides personalized recommendations, while azqr provides comprehensive compliance scanning against security benchmarks. This skill combines both approaches for thorough assessment.
